intro: Urostachys robustus, commonly known as the robust mountain grass, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and坚韧 (resilient), adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Urostachys robustus is often found in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes.
